Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a Data Scientist on the Product Analytics team to support the innovation, iteration, and optimization of our engagement products! This Data Scientist, Product will work as part of a cross-functional team of Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and User Researchers to better understand how members are interacting with Peloton products and to inform and evaluate new features and experiences developed by the Product team. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 


Own analytics for one core workstream on Peloton digital apps, from metrics definition and data instrumentation design to ongoing reporting, investigation, and generative research 


Be a key contributor to strategic decisions and roadmap formation for workstream


Collaborate with Product Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers to lead experimentation processes: designing and measuring A/B tests that help us understand the impact of new/alternate versions of features on user behavior


Define and own reporting and interpretation of KPIs & metrics for workstream, feature launches and A/B tests


Develop a deep understanding of user personas, fitness routines, and retention drivers for our members


Evaluate engagement trends across markets - compare workout/content engagement and feature usage among members within our growing global community


Become an authority on your workstream: provide insight into behaviors and difficulties of members on their journey from app download through sustained long-term engagement; help guide roadmap and evaluation of new features to enhance this user journey


Work in a lean and agile way, focusing on team members' desired outcomes over granular tasks and continuously assessing tradeoffs between precision and action-ability


YOU BRING TO PELOTON


BA/BS degree, preferably in a technical field


Have 3+ years of overall experience in an analytics capacity with a focus on problem-solving and providing concrete insights; some experience conducting analysis with a product/UX focus is desirable (an advanced degree may supply to years of experience)


Have solid technical skills when it comes to data wrangling and handling large datasets: can use SQL for data extraction (including sophisticated joins, CTE, window functions and query optimization), and have a proven understanding of Python syntax required for data cleaning and exploratory analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy)


Have experience with A/B testing and have demonstrated experience designing and assessing experiments


Have an understanding of statistics and data science methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions, and other machine learning techniques such as clustering)


Have shown experience defining and owning project success metrics


Have a passion for data storytelling via decks and dashboards and a shown ability to efficiently communicate your insights to non-technical audiences and senior leadership


Are comfortable leading your project timelines, prioritizing tasks with user and business impact in mind, assessing speed/precision tradeoffs, and proactively communicating project statuses to collaborators and teammates


Work well collaboratively, both in a cross-functional context - with Product Managers, Project Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers - and as a part of joint research projects with Product Analytics teammates


Are curious and humble: ask good questions, are always excited to learn new methods, approaches, and perspectives, and are eager to investigate interesting trends in the data 




Previous experience working on a product analytics team for a B2C software or software+hardware product


Solid understanding of event-based data collection and related technical concepts (e.g. SDK, device vs. cloud mode, schema management) and tools (e.g. Segment)


Experience with product analytics SaaS tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, Pendo, etc.)


Experience with social engagement features/products, growth loops, network effects and product virality 


Understanding of adjacent quantitative and qualitative research methods and techniques (e.g. usability testing, concept testing, market sizing, etc.)

Title: VP, Marketing Strategy and Operations
RoleDescription:
Peloton is looking for a Vice President, Marketing Strategy, Member Engagement & Insights. Reporting to the Chief Marketing Officer, this role oversees Pelotons global marketing strategy & operations, membership strategy and engagement, and the consumer insights & strategy team. The right candidate will have the ability to partner with senior leaders across marketing and cross-functional organizations, like Product and Finance, to ensure we have a strong, data-led strategy that is widely understood and pulled through the teams GTM plans. Theyll be responsible for guiding and reporting on marketing KPIs that inform both short- and long-term strategy to drive growth, brand love, engagement, and retention. The right leader is both a strategic "big thinker" who can set the vision for the team and a strong operator, willing to be in the details of tactics and execution. This person should also have strong business acumen and be able to tie data and initiatives back to the marketing and company strategy.

Drive Pelotons annual and quarterly global Marketing strategy, tied back to the companys goals, ensuring regional nuances are accounted for in messaging, engagement, and insights
Set marketing goals, objectives and track progress against key performance indicators
Oversee Marketing wide budget, operations and ways of working to improve efficiency and effectiveness
Lead Consumer Insights & Strategy team, providing data led insights to drive product pipelines, campaign feedback, brand metrics and solutions for relevant business challenges and opportunities
Oversee output across the full funnel (upper, mid, lower, and engagement) to ensure branding and messaging feel consistent from a consumer perspective
Drive strategy and GTM for member strategy and engagement to drive an increased engagement with our products and content and prevent churn
Build strong cross-functional relationships within the Marketing team, Content & Product and advocate for the strategic vision among these teams
Develop Quarterly Business Review and Board of Director presentations with compelling data led storytelling
Set clear goals and outputs for the Strategy, Engagement & Insights team
Develop team talent to drive growth and retention

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum of 15 years of Marketing strategy experience.
Minimum of 8 years leading high-performing teams, including managing senior-level talent and cross-functional groups.
Track record of successfully driving marketing initiatives across multiple international markets, balancing global brand consistency with local adaptation.
Experience with Consumer Insights and retention strategy a plus.
Marketing Operations experience and a demonstrated ability to optimize processes, improve efficiency, and ensure alignment between strategy and execution. a plus.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence peers and partners at all levels of the company.
Exceptional business acumen, with a results-oriented mindset and the ability to connect data and initiatives back to broader marketing and company goals.
Proven track record in building and retaining top-tier talent, creating a culture of growth, accountability, and innovation within the marketing organization.

Title: Sr. Software Engineer, E-Commerce
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE 
Peloton is looking for a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer for our E-Commerce Subscriptions team to help scale Peloton's $1+ billion e-commerce channel. You will be responsible for growing and executing the technical roadmap of innovative features by partnering with your peers in product management, design, marketing, member support, international teams, etc. You should be comfortable moving back and forth between front end and back end, have a passion for technical and operational excellence, and relentlessly championing best practices in a continuously evolving and dynamic environment. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 

Develop on modern front-end web technologies, architectures, and building high performant user-friendly experiences on the web.
API development experience with a variety of languages.
Help to evolve our platform to best in class by providing guidance to the teams in terms of technical strategy and excellency. 
Write understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability, scalability and performance. Your code should set the bar for how to approach the next generation of Peloton microservices.
Conduct peer code reviews with empathy, providing constructive feedback and fostering a collaborative, supportive environment. 
Drive architecture meetings, cross-team dependencies, and design docs to help promote a culture of learning and constant improvement. 
Partner with stakeholders to identify technical trade-offs and to make informed technical and product decisions. 
Support other software engineers by taking part in pair programming and leading white boarding solutions, team discussions, and task breakdown. 

YOU BRING TO PELOTON 

6+ years of software development experience. 
3+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems. 
Proficiency in at least one JavaScript framework like React (preferred), Vue, or similar.
Experience with Python, Kotlin, Javascript/Typescript or similar languages.
Familiarity with accessing, querying and writing to data stores like PostgreSQL. 
Familiar with deployment toolings/environments such as Kubernetes, Docker, GitHub Actions, etc.
Strong product and technical mindset. 
Ability to contribute consistently and positively in a high-paced, fast-changed environment.
Passionate about technology, new ideas, and always willing to learn new things.
Good understanding of Agile, Lean, DevOps, and SRE principles. 
Acute attention to detail and dedication to quality. 

BONUS POINTS IF YOU 

Have experience working with subscriptions.
Have experience integrating and deploying to managed cloud infrastructure (AWS or GCP).
Have experience with microservices architecture and the backend-for-frontend pattern. 
1+ years of experience in the financial services industry, e-commerce, credit card and payment related product operations. 
Are able to take a project from scoping requirements through actual execution and delivery.
Participate in the software engineering community through meetups, conferences, or contributing to open-source projects.
Have experience migrating a monolithic system to an ecosystem of microservices. 
Have experience with or knowledge of TDD, DDD and Event Sourcing. 
Worked on a system with internationalization and localization.

Title: Senior Manager, Marketing Web Strategy
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE 
The Senior Manager of Marketing Web Strategy will build and optimize Pelotons web experience to elevate brand perception, engagement, product education, and conversion. The right person for this role obsesses over the user journey and understands how to build a strategy and optimize touchpoints throughout the web funnel. This leader will be responsible for how the brand comes to life on our website, ensuring consumers understand the full Peloton experience.
The ideal candidate has a breadth of strategic, creative, and analytical skills, and communicates effectively, establishing relationships and encouraging collaboration. You are experienced in developing testing hypotheses, writing briefs, analyzing results, and influencing cross-functional partners in a matrixed organization. The role will report into the Director of Performance Creative and will work closely with teams across Peloton including eComm, Marketing Analytics, Media, Brand Marketing, SEO, Creative, Product Marketing, and Legal.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Lead and run the web strategy and optimization of onepeloton.com and associated market-specific International websites in partnership with eComm and Organic Discovery teams.
Develop and direct a strategic vision for the homepage and other marketing-led public webpages, including consumer journey and information/messaging architecture to meet marketings objectives (improve brand perception, engagement, and conversion across web touchpoints).
Connect the dots across Brand, Product Marketing, Integrated Marketing, and Growth Marketing to prioritize web initiatives and ensure cohesion in execution.
Develop a quarterly learning agenda and test roadmap that aligns with your vision and the objectives, crafting hypotheses based on web performance, standard methodologies, and test outcomes. Share plans with cross functional partners and senior leadership.
Advocate for your vision, learning agenda, key performance indicators, and roadmap with the eComm team to ensure tests are prioritized.
Write corresponding test briefs for Creative and eComm teams.
Track and share out comprehensive performance analysis across traffic, engagement, and conversion with Marketing peers and leadership on a regular basis.
Deeply understand Pelotons current target audience and promote their needs and purchase barriers when crafting web solutions and future testing.
Develop web strategy and recommendations for markets with different levels of maturity.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

7+ years of marketing strategy experience in web marketing, brand architecture, and/or product marketing roles; experience working for a subscription company a plus.
Consistent track record of achieving results through web experimentation, conversion rate optimization, and deep understanding of the user funnel.
Outstanding brief-writing skills.
Effective interpersonal and communication skills with ability to influence cross-functional partners.
Analytical approach and ability to identify data-informed insights.
Familiarity with web analytics tools such as Optimizely, Amplitude, and Google Analytics.
Excellent project management skills with attention to detail and organization.
Flexible mentality; comfortable operating in a fluid environment.

Title: Sr. Supplier Quality Engineer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Sr. Supplier Quality Engineer will be focused on our component supply. This position is critical for ensuring the delivery of quality components from established suppliers and developing new suppliers to meet Pelotons quality requirements. You will manage all quality-related communication between Peloton and suppliers to manufacturing and distribution centers. As a main technical interface for our component suppliers, you will be responsible for driving problem-solving accountability (8Ds), reviewing and approving the implementation of process/part changes, and identifying opportunities for continuous improvement. You will be the responsible escalation point for internal and field concerns regarding component quality. As an individual, you are independent, highly motivated, super organized, hyper-flexible, and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment to protect and improve product quality.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Quality Systems: Maintain and improve company quality management systems (QMS) in compliance with applicable regulatory & Peloton requirements related to control of processes and product.
Management: Responsible for representing overseas quality team onsite, training, and ongoing support of staff. Required to effectively communicate project goals to Suppliers. Provide technical guidance and training (mentorship) to suppliers to their ongoing development to reach company goals. Manage supplier audit program and suggest new suppliers to audit.
Product Development: Be a key member of the Peloton product development team onsite representing the Supplier Quality function. Steer and support the design control aspects of product quality, program management, and quality planning from product design through manufacturing. Assess, support and process supplier approvals and re-approvals in the approved supplier list (ASL).
Process Verification and Validation: Provide input regarding appropriate statistical methods, test facilities and equipment. This can include process validation, equipment installation/operational qualification, etc.
Production: May develop and implement quality inspection procedures including sampling plans, for production level components, sub-assemblies and finished goods. May also be responsible for the development and implementation of inspection methodologies, fixtures, measurement systems and calibration of such. Monitor, support and resolve production related quality issues with material suppliers.
Auditing: Responsible for overall audit program execution. Developing, implementing, and auditing risk-based annual quality control audit plans and schedules. Conduct and lead supplier, internal and external GMP(Good Manufacturing Practice) and ISO compliance audits. supports production line qualification initiatives, continuous improvement, and regulatory compliance across all supplier sites. Reports results and recommendations for changes as required. Confirms acceptable follow up action on audits. Monitors performance to audit schedules, execution, reporting and audit finding closures within established audit plans and timelines.
Documentation: Create, review, and approve controlled documents on an electronic document control system (e.g. supplier audit plans and reports, nonconformance reports, Quality Manual, work instructions, quality specifications, engineering specifications, lot history and device master records, procedures and validation protocols and reports, etc.). Generate and complete supplier records for approvals in the ASL.
Training: Coordinates and/or provides training to staff in GMP/ISO, Quality Systems, Supplier Quality, and Safety awareness. Provides ongoing development and maintenance of training materials and records.
Compliance: Ensures compliance with company quality policies and practices by participating in product and material reviews, assist in troubleshooting problems related to the manufacture, testing, validation and documentation. May be responsible for aspects of MRB, corrective actions, process control, complaints, document control, calibration & preventive maintenance programs and product/process/equipment validation activities.
Work with Peloton Quality Control team to develop and implement inspection and escalation plans
Coordinate disposition and cost recovery for non-conforming material from suppliers
Drive supplier root cause analysis and corrective actions (8D) and validate results ensuring proper closed-loop corrective action process
Report weekly on defect rate and quality issues
Participate in Continuous Improvement activities to drive improved part design, cost reduction, and yield improvement
Drive JDM/CM accountability and facilitate communication with Peloton Management
Track and provide updates on Quality issues
Manage monthly Quality review meetings with JDM/CM.

 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of experience working as a supplier quality engineer in a similar fast-paced industry
Education in Engineering/Manufacturing
Demonstrated experience in robust supplier quality and applied knowledge with ISO9001, IATF16949, APQP, SPC, MSA, FMEA, QOS, PPAP, 8D
Robust understanding of 2D drawings and GD&T
Experience with CAD tools (Solidworks knowledge is a plus)
Capable to perform Gage R&R, capability studies
Lean/Six Sigma, Green or Black Belt a plus
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Ability to identify bottlenecks in a process and drive improvement

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a results-oriented Associate Media Planner to join its Global Media Planning & Buying team. Reporting to the Manager, Media, this role will be responsible for supporting the full lifecycle of global offline media campaigns, from strategy development and budget management, to execution, optimization, measurement, and reporting. The ideal candidate possesses a deep understanding of the offline media landscape, including but not limited to TV, CTV/OTT, Streaming Audio, Podcasts, Direct Mail, and OOH. You have experience defining relevant KPIs (e.g., CPVs, response rates, reach, iCAC), as well as working knowledge of different buying strategies (direct vs. programmatic), optimization levers, and measurement methodologies to drive growth and performance.

Oversee daily budget pacing and ensure efficient spend allocation.
Deliver weekly performance reports with actionable insights and optimization recommendations.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to extract insights from data, implement findings into channel strategies, and communicate key takeaways.

High level of proficiency in Google Suite; (Looker experience is a plus).
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills, including pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, and media-related formulas.
Exceptional project management abilities with a keen attention to detail.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills; must be a proactive self-starter.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while managing multiple priorities.
Experience in DTC and/or subscription-based businesses is a plus.

Title: Director, Membership Retention
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE 
Peloton is looking for a Director of Membership Retention who will play a key role in reducing churn and improving member engagement. Reporting to the Senior Director, Membership Strategy & Engagement, this leadership role will focus on driving and optimizing member retention strategies, improving member satisfaction, and ensuring alignment with broader business goals. You will lead a team that focuses on implementing effective initiatives to engage members at every touchpoint, using data-driven insights to cultivate long-term loyalty and reduce churn. If you are passionate about lifecycle marketing, member engagement, and retention, and have experience implementing large-scale strategies, we encourage you to apply.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Create and lead data-driven, member-centric strategies to reduce hard churn, soft churn, and membership pauses. Ensure these strategies align with overarching business goals and deliver measurable results in membership retention.
Identify and capitalize on new business opportunities, partnerships, and revenue streams that can improve member engagement, enhance member value, and reduce long-term churn.
Partner closely with key team members in Product, PMM (Product Marketing), Analytics, FP&A, Creative, Content, and Acquisition to develop and implement integrated retention strategies. Ensure retention efforts are aligned with product features, member insights, and overall business objectives.
Responsible for efforts to deepen understanding of member behaviors, preferences, and pain points. Use this knowledge to advise pre-churn tactics and proactively delight existing members, creating strategies to exceed member expectations and increase satisfaction.
Lead efforts specific to member churn reduction, primarily, but not limited to: Re-engagement of inactive members Machine learning-based churn risk profiling Optimization of cancellation and pause reactivation processes Addressing payment failure and soft churn
Own and optimize critical communication channels to engage members, including Email, SMS, Push Notifications, and HW notifications. Work closely with Creative and Content teams to ensure messaging is personalized, timely, and relevant.
Promote a culture of experimentation within the team, always testing and optimizing retention strategies. Use data-driven insights to refine messaging, targeting, and engagement tactics across channels.
Monitor, analyze, and report on campaign performance regularly. Utilize performance data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas of improvement.
Develop actionable insights to continually refine and improve future campaign strategies.
Lead and mentor a high-performing team of direct reports, providing guidance, feedback, and career development opportunities. Establish clear objectives for the team, ensure they are accountable to performance goals, and support professional growth.
Develop, prioritize, and lead long-term retention strategies, aligning with broader company initiatives. Develop clear, actionable roadmaps that result in measurable progress in member retention.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

10+ years of experience in retention marketing, lifecycle/CRM roles, or similar, with a track record of leading comprehensive campaigns across digital channels such as email, SMS, and push notifications.
6+ years of experience leading and mentoring teams, including managing and guiding direct reports to meet strategic objectives and improve performance.
Familiarity with the subscription business model and deep understanding of the customer lifecycle. Extensive experience within the retention space.
Production and implementation of direct marketing programs across digital channels - email, SMS, in-app, push notifications. Experience with a physical hardware product a plus.
Proficient understanding of marketing automation platforms like Braze, Salesforce, Litmus, or similar tools. Proficiency in HTML and a deep understanding of best practices in email and digital design.
Solid understanding of data analytics tools (Google Analytics, Tableau, Excel, etc.) and ability to analyze campaign performance, derive insights from data, and adapt strategies to optimize results.
Exceptional attention to detail and a meticulous approach to measuring and improving marketing performance.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and other key team members. 
Effective interpersonal skills with a collaborative, team-oriented approach to working across functions.
Experience leading and inspiring a cross-functional team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Demonstrated experience managing and developing a team, including mentoring junior and mid-level team members and planning for their professional growth.
Ability to navigate and influence partners at all levels of the organization, driving alignment around shared goals.

Peloton is seeking a dynamic, highly motivated, and data-centric Associate Manager to join our Global Lifecycle & Engagement Marketing team. This role is equally focused on two key areas: supporting the ongoing strategy and execution of Apparel lifecycle marketing and partnering with Growth Marketing to own the scaling of upsell and cross-sell strategies across the member base.
Were looking for a proven track record of operational excellence supporting broad Lifecycle programs. There will be a high degree of collaboration with other teams.  The ideal candidate has experience with developing multi-channel lifecycle messaging strategies at apparel and/or subscription businesses and is comfortable with the technical aspects of email, SMS and push notification building. 
Were a fast-paced, action-oriented team that thrives on collaboration, making data-driven decisions, and challenging the status quo to most effectively deploy personalized, consumer-centric communications across the consumer journey.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Lifecycle Communication Strategy: Own and execute multi-channel lifecycle marketing strategies that support both Apparel and Growth initiatives while keeping the Member Experience first. 
Develop and implement strategies that enhance the member experience and foster long-term engagement.
Comprehensive Channel Management: Oversee all communications across multiple channels, including email, in-app, push notifications, on-hardware notifications, and SMS   ensuring a consistent and seamless multi-channel member journey.
Oversee end-to-end Apparel campaign strategy and execution, including building in Braze. Serve as the main liaison between Apparel and Member Lifecycle teams to ensure alignment of timing, campaign goals, member segments, and frequency capping.

Propose and execute A/B tests within each of the relevant areas of focus and optimize campaigns based on data-driven insights.
Analyze and report on campaign performance on an ongoing basis to ensure campaigns are performing as expected and improve future campaign strategies and tactics.
Work cross-functionality with, Data Analytics and Marketing Ops teams to ensure Members are receiving the most relevant and contextual communications.
Develop and maintain clear and concise presentations that communicate strategy, initiatives roadmap, performance metrics, and contribution to revenue.
Develop, maintain, and share-out process documentation.
Effective communication with peers and managers.

At least 2 years of experience in production and implementation of direct marketing programs using email, SMS, and push notification messaging.  
Analytical Skills: Exceptional ability to analyze campaign performance and adapt strategies based on robust data-driven insights. Strong attention to detail. 
Communication Skills: Outstanding communication skills with proficiency in developing clear and concise presentations for diverse audiences.
Strong project management and organizational skills with a proven track record managing parallel workstreams.
Comfort operating independently in a fast-paced environment; must be adaptable and willing to take on additional responsibilities as necessary.

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Peloton Treasury Team is looking for a talented treasury professional to join our team! The ideal candidate is a self-starter, analytical, attentive to detail, and highly organized. Moreover, the candidate is someone who consistently exceeds expectations and excels in quantitative and qualitative analytics. Having a solid foundation in Treasury and an interest in capital markets and macroeconomic trends is a plus. The Associate will support Pelotons banking activities, liquidity management and analytics, capital market reporting, maintenance of procedures, and support ad-hoc Treasury projects. Collaborate internally and externally to ensure timely and accurate processing of Treasury payments, including wires and ACH, FX, and credit card activity.

Bachelors Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or related field.

Experience with Excel (vlookups, pivot tables, conditional formatting).
Excellent analytical skills and ability to identify areas to improve processes.
Strong problem solving and decision-making skills with an analytical mindset.
Experience with FX and investment management concepts.
Familiarity with treasury management systems and ERP experience (Kyriba, Netsuite, etc.)
Familiarity with and interest in capital markets and macroeconomic analysis.
Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple workstreams simultaneously.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a Director, Editorial, Social, and Creator Marketing. The role will be responsible for Pelotons social, creator and editorial strategy and calendar. This position reports directly to the SVP, Brand and Consumer Marketing. In this high-impact role, you will craft storytelling, develop content strategy, and refine our brand presence across multiple platforms. Further, you will collaborate with Marketing, Communications, and Content to develop a comprehensive editorial calendar that will shape the narrative on our social channels, blog, and communications outreach. Youll be responsible for the briefing and development of social led initiatives, building innovative partnerships with creators, and crafting our editorial voice to ensure consistency and impact. You will constantly strive to build innovative, bar-raising content, inclusive campaign work, influencer programs, and multicultural initiatives. You are comfortable experimenting and leading a roadmap that is flexible, adapting to meet the needs of our Members, businesses, and partner teams. 
We're seeking an innovative leader with expertise in brand communications, social media, digital marketing, and community engagement to drive growth and amplify our brand presence. You will work in close partnership with the Content Social team to refine and implement our strategy on Meta, TikTok, Reddit, X, LinkedIn, and Snapchat to ensure we continuously optimize our go-to-market approach aligned to consumer behavior. You will position our work as culturally and contextually aware to creatively breakthrough and be effective in driving short and long term brand and business results. To accomplish this, you will bring cross-functional strategic influence to the role and assist in mapping out and identifying future opportunities for growth. Collaboration with internal teams, external stakeholders, and creative partners is essential to driving innovative and impactful campaigns. You are both a strategic, big thinker who can set the vision for the team and a strong operator, willing to be in the details of tactics and execution. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 

Collaborate with Content Social on the strategy, performance reporting, and optimization of Pelotons owned social channels to improve brand affinity and customer acquisition.
Aggregate, prioritize and develop all briefings for Marketing content on social channels; this content includes social plans for campaigns, tentpoles, brand partnerships and product marketing priorities.
Stay attuned to cultural trends and translate real-time insights into compelling, on-brand content.
Lead creator ambassador program that identifies, partners with, and builds strategic briefs for Peloton ambassadors to create content designed to increase awareness and consideration, and drive new customer acquisition.
Oversee complete communications planning for Social and Editorial channels ensuring alignment with the broader brand marketing calendar, integrated campaigns, press priorities, and SEO objectives.
Define and track KPIs, develop learning agendas, and lead all aspects of measurement frameworks to continuously refine strategy and execution.
Own and lead Pelotons global editorial strategy, ensuring alignment on key themes and initiative timing across Marketing, Content, and Product teams.
Cultivate cross-functional relationships across Marketing, Content, Communications, and Product teams to ensure seamless collaboration.
Mentor and develop team talent, driving growth, engagement, and long-term retention.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Minimum of 10 years of editorial and social media experience.
Experience working in a fast paced and highly matrixed organization.
Demonstrated track record of success leading social channels.
At least 5 years of people management experience, including leading and developing teams of managers and senior managers. Proven ability to provide strategic direction, mentorship, and career development support to leaders at multiple levels within an organization.
Experience across global markets.  
Background in editorial strategy, content production, or journalism, ideally within a media or newsroom environment.
Experience leading large-scale and complex business with senior internal and external partners. 
Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence peers and partners at all levels.
Demonstrates business sense and results orientation.
Builder of successful teams and able to nurture and retain talent.

ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we are seeking a Senior Manager of Support Knowledge and Content to transform our member support services with expert knowledge management, onsite at our Plano, Texas office. This role is crucial for driving enhancements in our support center's effectiveness and boosting the overall member experience. You will take charge of optimizing our service delivery by developing and maintaining critical resources such as chatbots, internal knowledge articles, macros, self-service tools, and managing our internal department communications. Collaborating with our Service Design team and cross-functional partners, you will ensure that our strategies remain aligned with evolving policies and business changes. 
As a leader within the Member Support team, you will champion the adoption of knowledge management best practices, mentoring your colleagues and team to ensure information is both accessible and user-friendly. Your strategic vision will be essential, but your willingness to engage directly with the challenges will truly set you apart. You are committed to nurturing an environment that values continuous learning and proactive knowledge sharing, all aimed at creating exceptional experiences for our members. You will be crucial in developing and executing our strategy in Member Support for documentation, internal department communications, the use of AI both internally and externally facing.

Strategic Leadership and Implementation: Spearhead the development and execution of strategic knowledge management initiatives that enhance the effectiveness of our support services and improve the overall member experience. YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5-7 years of experience in program management or knowledge management within a support or customer experience organization, preferably in the technology industry.
Practical experience applying and implementing Knowledge Centered Service (KCS) principles and practices. 
Previous experience building and supporting Generative AI chatbots, bonus for experience using Ada.

Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders to achieve business results.

German language speaking skills a plus 
High levels of emotional intelligence (EQ), empathy, and proactivity, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams through influence.

Title: Manager, IT SOX and Risk Assurance
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLEWe are looking for a highly motivated, strategic and solution-focused candidate to join our growing SOX and Risk Assurance team. In this role, you will support Pelotons global IT control environment and support the execution of our IT SOX program, helping to drive forward a culture of compliance, integrity and continuous improvement across the organization. The ideal candidate is passionate about IT risk management, thrives working collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and uses their creativity to inspire new ways of working and problem solving. You will serve as a trusted business partner and the connective tissue between the business, internal audit, and our external auditors, demonstrating your technical and internal controls expertise to help us continually assess and manage risks in the IT environment while also supporting business objectives. An ability to think critically and execute effectively while collaborating with business partners and control owners across the organization will be key to success in this role. This position will report to the Senior Manager of IT SOX and Risk Assurance as part of our Finance organization, and be based out of our New York HQ on a hybrid work basis.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Work within the Second Line of Defense (SOX) team, acting as an advisor to the IT and driving the design, implementation and monitoring of Peloton's risk and control framework
Lead and manage the execution of the IT SOX program, including the monitoring, application and reporting of IT General (ITGC) controls, IT Application (ITAC) controls, and key reports in accordance with SOX 404 requirements and corporate standards.
Analyze processes, risks, and controls related to the IT environment to identify improvement opportunities, recommend solutions that are pragmatic and achievable, and partner with management to resolve deficiencies.
Identify and drive opportunities for automation and using data analytics within the audit process to gain efficiencies and increase audit effectiveness; cohesively bridge the gap between upstream and downstream processes by increasing reliance on key systems and reports.
Perform comprehensive IT risk assessments to identify potential compliance risks and vulnerabilities. Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies to address any identified risks.
Evaluate new system implementations for control considerations, and partner with system owners to ensure appropriate IT controls are designed and in place prior to the systems go live.
Assist IT business partners and GRC team with user access reviews, monitoring controls, and SOC report assessments including providing guidance and recommendations to ensure compliance with corporate standards and SOX requirements.
Provide IT expertise and support on various special projects and company-wide initiatives, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards, including assisting in the development and implementation of IT policies and procedures to support business objectives.
Understand the importance of implementing emerging technologies into Pelotons ecosystem such as AI and ML while also being cognizant of their inherent risks.
Develop and deliver high quality and engaging training programs for control owners and other stakeholders to support their understanding and compliance with SOX requirements.
Collaborate with internal and external auditors to facilitate SOX audits and ensure timely completion and resolution of issues.
Prepare and present executive level communications on IT SOX and Compliance workstreams, including SOX Steering Committee and Audit Committee updates and recommendations.
Stay current with industry best practices, regulatory changes, and emerging trends in IT compliance
Proactively identify areas of improvement on an ongoing basis, providing guidance on best practices and offering actionable recommendations for process changes and potential solutions to drive efficiency and/or mitigate risk.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of relevant IT audit and SOX experience, with a mix of private and public accounting experience preferred
BA/BS degree with an emphasis on Computer Science, or its equivalent; CISA certification preferred
In-depth knowledge of SOX requirements, IT controls, and risk management, and proven expertise in designing and implementing SOX ITGCs, along with robust monitoring and reporting experience for ongoing compliance.
Experienced in working with modern cloud Software as a Service (SaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and agile environments; ability to adapt to ever changing system &amp; process landscape
Experience with NetSuite and SAP ERP systems preferred; understanding of core coding languages (e.g. SQL, Python) a plus.
Organized with strong project management skills, including effective consultation, coordination across multiple stakeholders/teams, prioritization of issues and organization
Outstanding communicator with keen ability to present findings in a succinct manner and tailor messaging as appropriate across a range of audiences
Ownership mentality; results-driven, self-starter, resourceful and comfortable with ambiguity
Superior problem-solving skills and ability to manage competing priorities and deadlines.
Ability to operate at both a strategic and execution level; ideate and directly execute.
 Positive outlook, intellectually curious, desire to continually learn and grow, team player.

Title: Manager, SOX and Risk Assurance
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a highly-motivated leader to join our growing SOX & Risk Assurance team, working primarily with our Precor business unit. This role will be responsible for operating as the Second Line of Defense within the Accounting Organization, establishing and maintaining policies and procedures that help monitor and enhance the companys global control environment and support management (First Line) in the identification of emerging risks. The SOX Manager will be a trusted business partner helping to design and optimize business processes and controls, while also operating as the primary liaison with internal audit (Third Line) and our external auditors on SOX compliance. The ideal candidate has a detailed knowledge of SOX and COSO framework, strong business process acumen, excellent communication and critical thinking skills, and an ability to collaborate effectively across a range of internal and external partners. This role offers a great opportunity to learn and grow within a high energy and innovative organization.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Work within the Second Line of Defense (SOX) team, acting as an advisor to the business and driving the design, implementation and monitoring of Peloton's risk and control framework
Lead and manage all aspects of SOX work for a newly implemented and maturing SOX program for the Precor business with a sense of urgency - from planning, design, testing, reporting and remediation.
Develop and maintain/update process documentation, procedures and controls, including flowcharts and Risk and Control Matrices; document narratives as vital.
Conduct process walkthroughs and risk assessments, evaluating design effectiveness of key business process controls; if deficiencies are identified, partner with management to design appropriate remediation plans with feasible timelines and monitor remediation to completion.
Provide guidance and support to control owners if they propose process or system changes (e.g.implementation of new systems, impact assessment for changes in people, process or technology).
Provide timely and proactive updates to the SOX & Finance leadership team on key risks, gaps, process enhancements, or any areas of potential concern.
Prepare and provide regular training on SOX and control requirements, risk management, and other relevant areas (e.g. management review controls, IPE procedures, etc.) to educate business process owners and reiterate the importance of compliance
Partner with the IT SOX team to ensure alignment on SOX approach, timing, controls reliance, external audit reliance, etc.
Provide creative input that will drive process efficiency across the organization and make valuable contributions to the audit process.
Establish and maintain excellent relationships within the team and cross-functional teams.
Find opportunities to leverage IT solutions to automate processes and create efficiencies in financial processes and strengthen internal controls.
Coordinate activities and strategies with internal and external auditors.
Participate in the preparation of leadership and Audit Committee materials.
Perform other related special studies or projects as assigned, meeting deadlines.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

BA/BS degree in Accounting/Finance or related field. CPA, CIA, or CISA preferred.
5+ years of relevant Internal Audit or SOX experience
Mix of private and public accounting experience (assurance or advisory) at a Big 4 or national public accounting firm.
Strong business process acumen and knowledge of standard processes and best practice, with direct experience with Order-to-Cash, Procure-to-Pay, Inventory and Financial Statement Close processes.
Working knowledge of IT systems - SAP, Salesforce, home grown systems, etc. and data analytics tools.
Highly organized, motivated, meticulous with the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Flexible and able to adapt quickly in a fast-moving environment; able to easily manage competing priorities and deadlines.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically to find solutions that meet compliance requirements while supporting business operations and objectives

ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking an experienced Marketing Analytics professional to lead our Marketing Measurement Strategy team, driving action through data-driven insights. In this highly visible role, you will set the strategic vision for our global marketing measurement framework and investment allocation. The Director, Marketing Measurement Strategy will lead key strategic initiatives, including marketing OKRs, learning agenda and experimentation, and Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM). Success in this role requires expertise in analytics, incrementality testing, and MMM, along with strong leadership and collaboration skills to drive action across all levels of the business. This role will lead a team of two and will report into the Senior Director of Global Marketing Analytics. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Define our measurement framework, including KPI identification, prioritization, and optimization. 
Partner with stakeholders to set OKRs that accurately measure success against strategic priorities. 
Allocate and optimize marketing investment across markets, products, and channels using mix modeling and experimentation.

Manage expectations regarding timing, capabilities, and the application of tests and analytics methodologies. 
Develop and deliver strategic recommendations and actionable insights to senior leadership. 
Ensure consistency in measurement frameworks across regions while adapting to market-specific nuances in marketing performance and strategy. 
Champion a culture of learning by sharing insights and learnings, driving continuous improvement in marketing effectiveness across teams and regions. 

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

10+ years of experience in marketing analytics, data science, or a related field, with a strong background in testing, measurement, and MMM. 
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. 
Proven leadership experience leading teams and driving large-scale analytics initiatives across global regions. 
Expertise in statistical analysis and modeling, with proficiency in tools such as R, Python, or similar.
Advanced communication skills to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences, including executive leadership. 
Extensive experience with experimental design and incrementality testing methodologies, including (but not limited to) A/B testing, geo-based testing, and pre/post analysis.

Passion for encouraging a data-driven, continuous improvement culture and contributing to the overall strategic direction of marketing initiatives.

Adept at fostering cross-functional collaboration and resolving challenges before they arise, ensuring work remains exciting and rewarding.
Known for driving inclusivity and engagement within teams that leads to a positive workplace culture.
Experience in mentorship, hiring, and cultivating talent, for all levels of IC designers. 
Passion for fitness, technology, and using design to create meaningful, connected experiences that empower people to live healthier, more active lives.

Title: Manager, Data Foundations
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we treat Data as a Product - a valuable asset and a critical piece of our decision making process. The Data Foundations team is responsible for providing several capabilities:

Persistence for all client and service data, across multiple persistence solutions (PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Elasticache, Redshift, Kafka, and graph databases).
Ingestion services, client libraries, and access patterns for all our operational persistence.
Retrieval services and libraries, caching services, and front-end infrastructure for engineering teams to understand and consume operational data.
Processing and routing pipelines that ensure privacy and compliance policies as data flows through the enterprise at the speed the business demands.

We are looking for an engaged, hands-on Engineering Manager to join our Data Foundations team to build and provide leadership across all four capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a passion for quality code and architecture, and will provide technical leadership as well as individual technical contribution as part of a team.Your team will be solving a wide range of problems related to data protection and security, observability across the entire ecosystem, and ensure the systems your build and support are highly available, secure, and provide the throughput our Members and Team Members demand. Our Members trust us to keep their data safe and secure, and youll play a key role in earning and keeping that trust, from guidance and implementation of data classification and retention policies, and ensuring sensitive data is protected and anonymized appropriately throughout the entire data lifecycle. As a people leader you will be responsible for career development and growth of your engineers, ensuring that they are motivated in doing their best work in line with their interests.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Staff and manage a team of engineers responsible for the Data Foundations, from data ingestion and routing, and meet all SLOs and SLAs for the products your team owns.
Be focused on eliminating toil within your team and your own customers through self-service tooling, and internally developed and published libraries for all the products you own.
Represent the Data Foundations team in internal customer meetings, cross functional workstreams,  maintain roadmaps for the team, help prioritize customer requests and drive iterative delivery of projects enabling our stakeholders to be successful. 
Establish team level performance indicators to measure efficiency of the teams output and impact to the Team Members we support.
Inspire a healthy, collaborative, empathetic engineering culture in line with Pelotons values, helping your team develop and grow along the engineering journey at Peloton.
Ensure that data pipelines are implemented with quality and observability included, along with appropriate encryption and tokenization techniques.
Partner closely with our security teams, ensuring logging and auditing mechanisms are in place and responding to any security incidents around the data infrastructure your teams support.
Champion engineering and operational excellence, drive database reliability and incident management by establishing metrics and processes for assessment and improvements.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

8+ years of software development experience in the data platform and datastores disciplines. You should be familiar with the inner workings of a data pipeline, understand the difference between streaming and batch processing data pipelines, and understand how a database engine builds a query plan.
Demonstrable experience in operating and supporting infrastructure within a cloud environment like AWS. Familiarity with orchestration tools like Kubernetes, and data orchestration services like Glue, Data Lake Formations, and Airflow is a plus.
Direct, hands-on experience in operating and managing a highly available datastore in production cloud environments (preferably AWS), such as PostgreSQL or MySQL, DynamoDB, Elasticache, or Kafka. Your team supports many different storage solutions, and familiarity with at least one is strongly preferred.
An understanding of the tradeoffs between data encryption and tokenization mechanisms, and how to manage the performance tradeoffs between them.
Prior experience managing and growing individual contributors. Your feedback and coaching is critical to the success of your Team Members.
Experience with Python or Scala (or comparable high-level language) and experience working on large distributed systems and frameworks like Spark / Flink for data pipelines.
You have a product mindset - focused on working with internal customers, prioritizing projects and iteratively delivering customer value.
The ability to identify strength and weakness of individuals in order to maximize team effectiveness and provide guidance to individuals when needed for coaching or mentoring.
The ability and experience to mediate between competing product and technical priorities and align priorities and goals through collaboration with technical leads and product managers.
Passion for building stable and secure systems management practices.
You are pragmatic without compromising on software quality and standards.

Experience with designing RESTful API.
